title: Add Rust code generation support for Datadog API client

Currently the plugin supports TypeScript (datadog-api-client-typescript) and Python (datadog-api-client-python). This feature will enable users to build Rust applications with Datadog integration and receive idiomatic Rust code examples when requesting code generation.

title: Review agents for duplication and reorganize if necessary
description:
Audit existing agents in the plugin to identify:
- Overlapping functionality between agents
- Opportunities to consolidate similar capabilities
- Better organization structure if needed
- Duplication in agent descriptions or tools

Goal: Ensure each agent has a clear, distinct purpose without unnecessary overlap.
close_reason: Completed comprehensive audit of 49 agents. Created detailed reorganization proposal (AGENT_REORGANIZATION_PROPOSAL.md) and filed 10 follow-up issues for implementation across 3 phases.

title: Create RELEASING.md with automated release workflow
description:
Create a RELEASING.md document that guides an agent through the complete release process:

1. Version Bumping:
   - Read current version from .claude-plugin/plugin.json
   - Semantic versioning: minor (new features), patch (bug fixes), major (breaking changes - ask first)
   - Update version field in plugin.json

2. Plugin Validation:
   - Alphabetically sort the 'skills' array
   - Alphabetically sort the 'agents' array
   - Validate plugin.json is valid JSON

3. Release PR:
   - Create a new branch for release
   - Commit version bump and sorted arrays
   - Submit PR with changes
   - Wait for human review and merge

4. Release Tagging:
   - After PR merged, pull from main
   - Create git tag matching version (e.g., v1.10.0)
   - Push tag to remote

5. GitHub Release:
   - Create GitHub release for the tag
   - Generate release description summarizing changes since last release
   - Include all PRs, features, bug fixes merged

6. CHANGELOG Management:
   - Update CHANGELOG.md with release notes
   - Include version, date, and categorized changes (Added, Changed, Fixed)
   - Commit CHANGELOG update

The RELEASING.md should be clear enough for an agent to follow autonomously while including checkpoints for human approval (major version bumps, PR review).
close_reason: Created comprehensive RELEASING.md with step-by-step release workflow, semantic versioning guide, array sorting requirements, validation steps, and agent orchestration instructions. Also sorted agents array alphabetically in plugin.json.

title: Clarify observability pipelines scope and relationships
description: Investigate if observability-pipelines.md supersedes log-configuration.md pipelines. Document relationship and when to use each agent.
close_reason: Documented relationship: Observability Pipelines handle infrastructure-level data collection/routing (runs in user infra, pre-ingestion), while Log Configuration manages Datadog backend settings (pipelines, archives, indexes post-ingestion). Added comprehensive explanation to CLAUDE.md.

title: Decide on security agent organization strategy
description: Evaluate and decide between: Option A - Create security-overview.md routing agent; Option B - Merge security.md + application-security.md. Document decision rationale.
close_reason: Decision: Keep all security agents separate (Option C). Reject both Option A (routing agent) and Option B (merge). Rationale documented in SECURITY_AGENT_DECISION.md. Security agents represent distinct Datadog products with different APIs and use cases, and should remain focused and specialized. This maintains consistency with codebase patterns where no routing agents exist.
